item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Sundown Social returns for 2025! This week: tunes by Aidan Fisher, bites from Small's Big Taste + King of Pops, and a sip of Peachy Paradise.

item.title: Mother Son Dance
item.description: For the fifth year in a row, the City is offering families a Mother’s Day weekend event to celebrate the very special mom (or mother figure) in our younger residents’ lives.

item.title: A Hard Rain's A-Gonna Fall
item.description: Stormwater events have intensified in recent years due to increased development and climate change, stormwater events have had a negative impact on our neighborhoods, local streams, and the Chattahoochee watershed. Learn to mitigate this damage and create beauty in the process.

item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Kick back & relax at Sundown Social! This week: tunes by Billy Stonecipher, bites from Jerk Hut Wingz, and sips of Peachy Paradise.

item.title: National Kids to Parks Day
item.description: Join National Park Trust, Buddy Bison, and kids across America for a fun day of outdoor play! Visit one of the City's beautiful parks! Learn more on the City's website.

item.title: Astronomy Club - May meeting
item.description: Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly meeting. These meetings are free and open to all levels of experience. Each month offers a different topic, and each meeting ends with a stargazing session! Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Warm breezes & cool vibes! Enjoy tunes by Frank Whitaker, bites from Gyro Chef, and sips of Peachy Paradise.

item.title: City Green Live: Face 2 Face
item.description: Face 2 Face is an electrifying tribute band that pays homage to two iconic piano legends, Elton John and Billy Joel.

item.title: CONTINUOUS LOAD PATH IN RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION
item.description: Attend the next BUILD: SANDY SPRINGS seminar to discuss how to achieve a continuous load path with proper installation of metal straps, ties, and holdowns that meet the 2018 International Residential Code. There will be live demonstrations of how to properly install these devices.

item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Summer is officially here! This week, enjoy tunes by Logan Lee, bites from Paradiso Woodfire Pizza + King of Pops, and the final sips of Peachy Paradise.

item.title: The Finale 2025
item.description: The Finale is a show dedicated to highlighting the year-long work of The Performance Division at Elite Studios. It's the exciting culmination of a year’s worth of growth and training for our dancers.

item.title: Concerts by the Springs: Funk Force Five
item.description: Playing all of your favorite hits from the 60’s to today, from James Taylor to Taylor Smith, Funk Force Five will get you out of your seat and on to the dance floor with classic and current jams!

item.title: Sandy Spring Crafting Buddies
item.description: Join the Sandy Springs Crafting Buddies for an evening of social crafting. Bring your current work in progress, or materials to start a new project and come hang with us! Visit the City's website for more information.

item.title: Food That Rocks 2025
item.description: One Night Only, explore 20+ of Sandy Springs' most talked-about restaurants – all in one place. Discover your next favorite cocktail and destination date night spot. Meet local celeb and rising-star chefs, all while supporting Sandy Springs’ thriving restaurant scene.

item.title: Rockin' the Runway Fashion Show for Drake House
item.description: The 13th Annual Rockin’ the Runway is a fashion show fundraiser benefiting The Drake House, which empowers women and children experiencing homelessness. Along with the fashion show, you'll enjoy tasty bites from Sandy Springs’ best restaurants, a pop-up shop, and auction.

item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Sundown Social continues! More details to come.

item.title: City Green Live: September in the Park
item.description: September In The Park is the ultimate Earth, Wind & Fire and Chicago tribute – Combining the incredible horn arrangements and vocal harmonies that both groups are known for, September In The Park offers a one of a kind entertainment experience!

item.title: Astronomy Club - June meeting
item.description: ​​​​Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly meeting. These meetings are free and open to all levels of experience. Each month offers a different topic, and each meeting ends with a stargazing session! Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: ASO: The Music of John Williams
item.description: Relive the adventures of your favorite film characters through the power of a live orchestra performance! The Atlanta Symphony Orchestra fills Byers Theatre with the masterful film music of John Williams, who scored Star Wars, Jurassic Park, the Harry Potter series, and more.

item.title: Juneteenth Celebration
item.description: This family-friendly event is free and open to the public, offering a vibrant mix of educational experiences, live performances, and immersive art exhibitions in honor of Juneteenth.

item.title: Funny Fridays with Joel Byars, Jun 20
item.description: Kick off your weekend with a night of hilarious, clean-ish comedy at Funny Fridays, hosted by Atlanta's award-winning comedian Joel Byars! This high-energy comedy showcase transforms Studio Theatre into a comedy club, and features a rotating cast of top-tier local comics.

item.title: Sundown Social
item.description: Sundown Social continues! More details to come.

item.title: Astronomy Club - June Stargazer Event
item.description: Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly event. The Atlanta Astronomy Club (AAC) is one of the largest organizations of beginner and amateur astronomers in the southeastern United States. Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Sandy Spring Crafting Buddies
item.description: Join the Sandy Springs Crafting Buddies for an evening of social crafting. Bring your current work in progress, or materials to start a new project and come hang with us! Visit the City's website for more information.

item.title: Stars & Stripes 2025
item.description: Celebrate Independence Day, July 4

item.title: Concerts by the Springs: Troubadour Project
item.description: Step back in time to the golden era of rock 'n' roll with the Troubadour Project. Seamlessly blending the iconic sounds of Fleetwood Mac, Queen, Led Zeppelin, ELO, Peter Frampton, Supertramp, The Eagles and more. Each performance is a tapestry of rock history.

item.title: Funny Fridays with Joel Byars, Jul 18
item.description: Kick off your weekend with a night of hilarious, clean-ish comedy at Funny Fridays, hosted by Atlanta's award-winning comedian Joel Byars! This high-energy comedy showcase transforms Studio Theatre into a comedy club, and features a rotating cast of top-tier local comics.

item.title: Bird Walk at Overlook Park
item.description: Join us to view a wide variety of birds as they make their way to Morgan Falls Overlook Park. Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Astronomy Club - July meeting
item.description: Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly meeting. These meetings are free and open to all levels of experience. Each month offers a different topic, and each meeting ends with a stargazing session! Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: City Green Live: Black Jacket Symphony
item.description: Remember putting on an album and listening from start to finish? Relive that moment with a live concert experience unlike any other as The Black Jacket Symphony recreates Saturday Night Fever in its entirety—note for note, sound for sound.

item.title: Movies by Moonlight 2025
item.description: Enjoy a movie on the big screen under a beautiful night sky! Admission is free.

item.title: Concerts by the Springs: The Mike Veal Band
item.description: The Mike Veal Band plays a hot combination of blues, rock, funk and fun! Diverse musical backgrounds and regional influences color each member's contribution to the tight sound for which the band is loved.

item.title: Sandy Spring Crafting Buddies
item.description: Join the Sandy Springs Crafting Buddies for an evening of social crafting. Bring your current work in progress, or materials to start a new project and come hang with us! Visit the City's website for more information.

item.title: City Green Live: Moon Taxi
item.description: Nashville based indie alt-rock band Moon Taxi is back with tracks ranging from rock to synth to pop to bluegrass, delivered with a polished, classic sound.

item.title: Astronomy Club - August meeting
item.description: Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly meeting. These meetings are free and open to all levels of experience. Each month offers a different topic, and each meeting ends with a stargazing session! Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Funny Fridays with Joel Byars, Aug 22
item.description: Kick off your weekend with a night of hilarious, clean-ish comedy at Funny Fridays, hosted by Atlanta's award-winning comedian Joel Byars! This high-energy comedy showcase transforms Studio Theatre into a comedy club, and features a rotating cast of top-tier local comics.

item.title: The 2025 ISSA Awards
item.description: The International Singer-Songwriters Association's Annual Awards Show is a pivotal event for advancing the careers of independent artists since ISSA's start in 2018. A leading force in the music industry, ISSA spotlights its talented artists through this spectacular live event.

item.title: Sandy Spring Crafting Buddies
item.description: Join the Sandy Springs Crafting Buddies for an evening of social crafting. Bring your current work in progress, or materials to start a new project and come hang with us! Visit the City's website for more information.

item.title: Astronomy Club - Stargazing and Swap & Shop
item.description: Bring your used telescopes and observing gear to Morgan Falls Overlook for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's swap and shop event. Please join us if you are looking to buy or sell used astronomy equipment. Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Concerts by the Springs: Bourbon Brothers Band
item.description: Step back in time with The Bourbon Brothers Band, a musical journey through the pages of the American Songbook & the soulful era of the Rat Pack. The Bourbon Brothers Band channel the great Frank Sinatra as they sip bourbon and play classics.

item.title: Astronomy Club - September meeting
item.description: Attention Star Gazers! It's time for the Atlanta Astronomy Club's monthly meeting. These meetings are free and open to all levels of experience. Each month offers a different topic, and each meeting ends with a stargazing session! Visit the City's website to learn more.

item.title: Blue Stone Arts & Music Festival
item.description: Stroll along Blue Stone Rd to check out the art market, then groove to live music on multiple stages throughout the two-day event!

item.title: Sandy Spring Crafting Buddies
item.description: Join the Sandy Springs Crafting Buddies for an evening of social crafting. Bring your current work in progress, or materials to start a new project and come hang with us! Visit the City's website for more information.

item.title: BENISE - 25 Years of Passion!
item.description: Escape the ordinary with Benise, the Prince of Spanish Guitar, with an international cast of musicians and dancers! Celebrate 25 Years of Passion with fan favorites, rock classics like Led Zeppelin’s Kashmir, and Benise's signature touch on classical melodies like “Ave Maria.”

item.title: Blippi: Join the Band Tour
item.description: C'mon and join Blippi in the brand new, live Blippi: Join the Band Tour! Meekah, their singing and dancing buddies, and LIVE musicians will join Blippi to explore what makes music, including sounds, rhythms and instruments, through all your favorite Blippi hits.

item.description: Join us to view a wide variety of birds as they make their way to Morgan Falls Overlook Park. Visit the City's website to learn more.
